issue.title: A viewportQuad  causes  a groundPrimitive to exhibit overlapping!
issue.body:
When the width or height of the ViewportQuad is less than 20, it causes GroundPrimitive to exhibit overlapping!
![image](https://github.com/CesiumGS/cesium/assets/20767375/af5a190c-647b-4c8d-b2b1-fb2491f4e55a)


Sandcastle example:
    https://sandcastle.cesium.com/#

Browser:  Chrome  118.0.5993.117

Operating System: Windows 10

issue.title: Scaling of some tilesets in 2D mode
issue.body:
There is a strange scaling being applied to tiles in this scenario:
- `SceneMode.SCENE2D`
- `mapProjection: new Cesium.WebMercatorProjection()`
- tileset uses a geographic [`region`](https://github.com/CesiumGS/3d-tiles/tree/main/specification#bounding-volumes) for the tiles rather than bounds 

[Sandcastle example](https://sandcastle.cesium.com/#)

You can see the effect on features near the edge being scaled towards the centre (highlighted in red):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/484870/130393726-b5d97218-5f17-44a7-9962-f17b3c537ff9.png)

The result on another tileset:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/484870/130393382-feceb1c8-31d4-45d8-8211-d98221888dca.png)

comment.body: This appears to be fixed with the `projectTo2D` option: https://github.com/CesiumGS/cesium/pull/10384

issue.title: About building locally

labels.name: needs feedback
labels.description: On hold until additional info is supplied

issue.body:
Hi，
    When I add a class in the engine folder, how to reference it in widgets? For example, when I add a Cesium3DFilesetBak class (rename it after copying the Cesium3DFileset class), the buildWidgets process will report an error when I execute the npm run release command. The reference here seems to come from node_ Modules, the class I added cannot be recognized.
    What should be done correctly when adding a class and referencing it in Widgets?
![image](https://github.com/CesiumGS/cesium/assets/37999729/7f01e14c-1408-4eba-8d43-3bfb197a3b1d)

comment.body:
> When executing the npm run release, the buildEngine command should be executed first, followed by buildWidgets. However, in Widgets/.../Viewer.js, import {xxx} from "@ cesium/engine" directly introduces the dependency module from @ cesium/engine, which means it accesses "node_ Tmodules" folder, but the classes I added myself only exist in the package folder?

Ah, so you are running a build command after installing cesium as a node module and adding a new class?

I would not recommend this approach. Generally, it is not recommended to manually add or change code in the `node_module` directly. And secondly, cesium build commands are designed to be run from a cesium developer context, not from within the context of the installed node module. 

Instead, any new code should be added to your project directly. Could you tell us a bit more about the code you're looking to add? We may have some recommendations on how to architect your solution.

Finally, CesiumJS is a big project, so we use GitHub for feature requests and bug tracking exclusively. In the future, please take any questions to the [Cesium Forum](https://community.cesium.com/) where there are members of the community and developers from the team who can help. Thanks!

issue.body:
When the width or height of the ViewportQuad is less than 20, it causes GroundPrimitive to exhibit overlapping!
![image](https://github.com/CesiumGS/cesium/assets/20767375/af5a190c-647b-4c8d-b2b1-fb2491f4e55a)


Sandcastle example:
    https://sandcastle.cesium.com/#

Browser:  Chrome  118.0.5993.117

Operating System: Windows 10

comment.body:
Thanks @LyjPeppers!

I am able to duplicate after moving the camera a bit.

Lookin through the codebase, I don't think ViewportQuad is used much, though it is still technically part of the public API. At somepoint, we may even consider removing it to reduce the library footprint size.

I would recommend seeing if any other [primitive geometry](https://cesium.com/learn/cesiumjs-learn/cesiumjs-geometry-appearances/) works for your case.

issue.title: Minimum required attribution for Google 3D Tiles
issue.body:
By default, `createGooglePhotorealistic3DTileset` no longer shows credits on screen, as this is compliant with the minimum required attribution. Traditionally CesiumJS uses the minimum necessary to be compliant as to avoid any confusion about what is required.

To restore this behavior, pass the option `showCreditsOnScreen: true`.

comment.body:
Thanks for the pull request @ggetz!
* :heavy_check_mark: Signed CLA found.
* :grey_question: Unit tests were not updated.
    * Make sure you've [updated tests](https://github.com/CesiumGS/cesium/tree/main/Documentation/Contributors/TestingGuide) to reflect your changes, added tests for any new code, and ran the code coverage tool.

Reviewers, don't forget to make sure that:

- [ ] Cesium Viewer works.
- [ ] Works in 2D/CV.

pull_request.title: Minimum required attribution for Google 3D Tiles
pull_request.body:
By default, `createGooglePhotorealistic3DTileset` no longer shows credits on screen, as this is compliant with the minimum required attribution. Traditionally CesiumJS uses the minimum necessary to be compliant as to avoid any confusion about what is required.

To restore this behavior, pass the option `showCreditsOnScreen: true`.

issue.title: Create new simple example with vue2 and vite
issue.body: Hi everyone, im trying to create a simple example with vue2+vite and cesium 1.105.2 I use a vite plugin to copy node files to public: //vite.config.js ``` import copy from "rollup-plugin-copy"; ... copy({ targets: [ { src: "node_modules/@cesium/engine/Source/*", dest: "public/" }, { src: "node_modules/@cesium/engine/Source/WorkersES6/*", dest: "public/Workers" }, { src: "node_modules/@cesium/widgets/Source/*", dest: "public/Widgets" }, ], hook: 'buildStart' }) ``` and all files i need are copied to /public folder and its nice. But when i try to initialize the script bellow, i receive these erros in console and the result a black sky with start moving ``` //Hello world example code used Cesium.Ion.defaultAccessToken = CESIUM_KEY const viewer = new Cesium.Viewer('cesiumContainer'); ``` Error: Note. /Workers/createVerticesFromHeightmap.js is working in the indicated path. Result screen:

comment.body:
I found maybe a good solution to solve the problem. Here is the code [simply-cesium-vite-vue](https://github.com/s3xysteak/simply-cesium-vite-vue). Hope it helpful.
On my laptop, the bundling process only took 717ms, and the resulting "dist" folder was only 11.1 MB in size.
I have provided a detailed explanation of my approach in the readme. If there's anything I can assist you with, please feel free to ask. If you have any suggestions or improvements, I welcome them as well!
